citation.article-title: Characterization of two novel haloalkaliphilic archaea Natronorubrum bangense gen. nov., sp. nov. and Natronorubrum tibetense gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Natronorubrum tibetense (ti.bet.en'se. M.L. neut. adj. tibetense from/of Tibet)
Cells are pleomorphic, flat-shaped and uniformly stain Gram-negative.
Growth occurs in media containing 12-30% NaCl with an optimum at 20% NaCl.
Growth is between pH 8.5 and pH 11.0, with an optimum at pH 9.0.
The growth is stimulated by many sugars (glucose, fructose, maltose, sucrose and lactose).
Starch and casein are not hydrolysed.
H2S is not produced from thiosulfate.
Tween 40 and 60 are hydrolysed but Tween 80 is not.
The polar lipids are C20-C25 derivatives of PG, PGP and two uncharacterized minor phospholipids.
The G + C content of the DNA is 60-1 mol%.
Type strain is GA33T, deposited as AS 1.2123.
